original: GRANHOLM, Axel Magnus, fd Generaldirektör, Stockholm, f Smedjebacken, Kopparb l, 19/8 72 av handl A G o Clara Carlsson, gm Magda Krog. Mog.ex Falun 90, KTH (VoV) 90—94. Bitr ing h lantbr.ing i Kopparb l 94-^ 96, anst v väg- o vattenbyggn.distr f jvgs-undersökn 96, bitr ing v Stat jvgsbyggn 97—98, avd.ing 98—07, arb.ch 07—13, tilllika arb.chef v Vattenf.styr :s kraftvksbyggn v Porjus 10—13, generaldir o chef f SJ 14—37. Led av ktén betr Stat jvgsbyggn :s omorg 04, deleg v underhandl betr anknytn av sv jvgsnätet m det finsk-ryska 15—16, led av ktén f norrl sjöf :s ordn 17—18, styr.led i Ostkustbanan 18—22, led av ktén f ordn av traf m Östersjöns ostkust 18, av 18 års jvgskté 18 —22, ordf i ktén betr traf Sv—Finl 20—23, ordf i sv-norska mellanriksbanekommiss 21— 23, led av 32 års ostkustbanekté, sakk betr elektr stamlinjenätet 36, ordf i ktén f omorg av Vattenf.styr :s administration 36, i ktén f omorg av Telegrafvkts administration 39, i ktén f utredning ang skärgårdarnas kommunikationer 38—39, i jvgsgodstaxekomm 38—39, styr.ordf i Gävle vagnverkst 33, i AB Aero-transp 37—43, ordf o ch i Stat trafikkommiss 40. Styr.led KTH 33—37, en av huvudmännen f konung Oscar II :s jub.fond 33. Styr.ordf i Nord Jvgsmannasällsk 26—37, styr.led i STF 14—28, led av Sv Tekn.frn sed. 90, styr.led i dess avd V 14—15. KmstkNO, KmstkVO, Stk-BLeopII:sO, StkNedONO, StkTysköO, KDDO-Igr, KFinlVROlkl, KNS:tOOmkr, FFrKlkl, Iqml 18 storl m gk, GV:sPostJubM, SvRK:s GM 5:e storl, STF:s GM. LKrVa, Förste HedLIVA.
translated: GRANHOLM, Axel Magnus, former Director General, Stockholm, born in Smedjebacken, Kopparberg County, on August 19, 1872, to parents A G and Clara Carlsson, married to Magda Krog. Completed military service in Falun in 1890, attended the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) from 1890 to 1894 (Masters of Engineering in Civil Engineering). Acted as assistant agricultural engineer in Kopparberg County from 1894 to 1896, employed by the road and water construction district for road surveys in 1896, worked as an assistant for the Swedish National Road Administration from 1897 to 1898, promoted to department engineer from 1898 to 1907, employed as chief engineer from 1907 to 1913, concurrently served as chief engineer of the Water Board's power plant construction in Porjus from 1910 to 1913. Appointed as Director General and CEO of the Swedish State Railways (SJ) from 1914 to 1937. Participated in the commission for the reorganization of the Swedish National Road Administration in 1904, delegate for negotiations regarding the connection of the Swedish railway network with Finland and Russia from 1915 to 1916, member of the commission for the organization of shipping in Northern Sweden from 1917 to 1918, board member of the Ostkustbanan railway company from 1918 to 1922, participated in the commission for the organization of traffic along the Baltic Sea's East Coast in 1918, member of the 18-year railway commission from 1918 to 1922, chairman of the commission for traffic between Sweden and Finland from 1920 to 1923, chairman of the Swedish-Norwegian cross-border railway commission from 1921 to 1923, member of the 32-year Ostkustbanan railway commission, expert on the electric mainline network from 1936, chairman of the commission for the reorganization of the Water Board's administration in 1936, chairman of the commission for the reorganization of the Telegraph Administration in 1939, member of the commission for investigation of communication in the archipelagos in 1938-1939, member of the commission for railway freight tariffs in 1938-1939, chairman of the board of Gävle Wagon Works from 1933, board member of AB Aero-Transport from 1937 to 1943, chairman and member of the State Traffic Commission from 1940. Board member of KTH from 1933 to 1937, one of the main contributors to King Oscar II's Jubilee Fund from 1933. Chairman of the Northern Railway Society from 1926 to 1937, board member of the Swedish Tourist Association from 1914 to 1928, member of the Swedish Society of Engineers since 1890, board member of its V division from 1914 to 1915. Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star, Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa, Knight of the Belgian Order of Leopold II, Knight of the Order of Orange-Nassau (Netherlands), Knight of the Order of the Crown (Germany), Commander of the Order of the Polar Star, Commander of the Order of the White Rose of Finland 1st class, Commander of the Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Commander of the Estonian Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana, Royal Swedish Aero Club Gold Medal, Grand Cross of the Postal Jubilee Medal, Swedish Red Cross's Grand Gold Medal 5th class, Swedish Tourist Association's Gold Medal. Honorary Member of the Mechanics' Society of Uppsala, First Class Life Member of the Hederslegionen.
